headline: Private-Credit Warning Signs Flash After Blue Owl Unloads $1.4 Billion in Assets
summary: Wall Street has been eagerly selling private credit as a hot opportunity for individual investors.  Blue Owl Capital  a poster child for the industry, said it is liquidating $1.4 billion in assets to raise money to pay out individuals who bought into some of its funds in their heyday but now want to get out.  Stocks across the private-fund industry slid as the deal raised questions about how much fund managers can count on individuals to stay invested in hard-to-sell assets for the long term.

Stocks across the private-fund industry slid as the deal raised questions about how much fund managers can count on individuals to stay invested in hard-to-sell assets for the long term.

headline: Private equity stocks tumble as Blue Owl restricts fund redemptions
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of major private investment managers fell sharply on Thursday as Blue Owl Capital’s decision to permanently restrict investor withdrawals from a retail debt fund sent ripples through the private credit industry.

headline: Blue Owl halts fund redemptions, sends private credit stocks lower
summary: Private credit firms are seeing their stocks fall on Thursday after Blue Owl (OWL) permanently halted private credit fund redemptions. Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman discusses this news in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
